_**Mankatha**_ is the [soundtrack album](/wiki/Soundtrack_album "Soundtrack album"), composed by [Yuvan Shankar Raja](/wiki/Yuvan_Shankar_Raja "Yuvan Shankar Raja"), to the 2011 film [of the same name](/wiki/Mankatha "Mankatha"), directed by [Venkat Prabhu](/wiki/Venkat_Prabhu "Venkat Prabhu") starring [Ajith Kumar](/wiki/Ajith_Kumar "Ajith Kumar"). The album features eight tracks, with lyrics penned by [Vaali](/wiki/Vaali_\(poet\) "Vaali \(poet\)"), [Gangai Amaran](/wiki/Gangai_Amaran "Gangai Amaran"), and Niranjan Bharathi.[1] Following a number of postponements,[2][3] it was finally released on 10 August 2011 by [Sony Music India](/wiki/Sony_Music_India "Sony Music India"). 

The soundtrack was described as a "m√©lange of techno, melody, a couple of duets and a mass song".[4] The album features eight tracks, including one [Theme music](/wiki/Theme_music "Theme music") track and one [club mix](/wiki/Electronic_dance_music "Electronic dance music").[5] The first track of the album, "Vilaiyaadu Mankatha" was launched as a [single release](/wiki/Single_\(music\) "Single \(music\)") in mid-May 2011, three months prior to the soundtrack release.[6]

Ltd.** is an Indian music [record label](/wiki/Record_label "Record label") operated by [Sony](/wiki/Sony "Sony") and headquartered in [Mumbai](/wiki/Mumbai "Mumbai"), [Maharashtra](/wiki/Maharashtra "Maharashtra"). It holds a 25% share of the [Indian music market](/wiki/Indian_Music_Industry "Indian Music Industry"), ranking behind [T-Series](/wiki/T-Series_\(company\) "T-Series \(company\)") and ahead of [Zee Music Company](/wiki/Zee_Music_Company "Zee Music Company"), with which it has a strategic partnership.[2][3]

**Super Cassettes Industries Private Limited** ,[a][1][3] [doing business as](/wiki/Trade_name "Trade name") **T-Series** ,[b] is an Indian [record label](/wiki/Record_label "Record label") and [film studio](/wiki/Film_studio "Film studio") founded by [Gulshan Kumar](/wiki/Gulshan_Kumar "Gulshan Kumar") on 11 July 1983.[5] It is primarily known for [Hindi film](/wiki/Hindi_film_music "Hindi film music") soundtracks[5] and [Indi-pop](/wiki/Indi-pop "Indi-pop") music.[6] T-Series is the largest music record label in India, with up to a 35% share of the [Indian music market](/wiki/Indian_Music_Industry "Indian Music Industry").[7] As of November 2025, T-Series also owns and operates the [most-viewed](/wiki/List_of_most-viewed_YouTube_channels "List of most-viewed YouTube channels") and the [second most-subscribed YouTube channel](/wiki/List_of_most-subscribed_YouTube_channels "List of most-subscribed YouTube channels"), with over 307 million subscribers[8] and 318 billion views.[9] While best known as a music label, T-Series has [also produced more than 100 films](/wiki/List_of_T-Series_films "List of T-Series films"), and has established itself as a leading film production company in [Hindi cinema](/wiki/Hindi_cinema "Hindi cinema"). 

Kumar, initially a fruit juice seller in [Delhi](/wiki/Delhi "Delhi"), founded T-Series to sell [pirated](/wiki/Copyright_infringement "Copyright infringement") Hindi songs before the company eventually began producing new music. Their breakthrough came with the soundtrack for the 1988 [Bollywood](/wiki/Bollywood "Bollywood") blockbuster _[Qayamat Se Qayamat Tak](/wiki/Qayamat_Se_Qayamat_Tak "Qayamat Se Qayamat Tak")_ , composed by [Anand‚ÄìMilind](/wiki/Anand%E2%80%93Milind "Anand‚ÄìMilind"), written by [Majrooh Sultanpuri](/wiki/Majrooh_Sultanpuri "Majrooh Sultanpuri"), and starring [Aamir Khan](/wiki/Aamir_Khan "Aamir Khan") and [Juhi Chawla](/wiki/Juhi_Chawla "Juhi Chawla"), which became one of the best-selling Indian music albums of the 1980s, with over 8 million sales. They eventually became a leading music label with the release of _[Aashiqui](/wiki/Aashiqui "Aashiqui")_ (1990), composed by [Nadeem‚ÄìShravan](/wiki/Nadeem%E2%80%93Shravan "Nadeem‚ÄìShravan"), which sold 20 million copies and became the best-selling Indian [soundtrack album](/wiki/Soundtrack_album "Soundtrack album") of all time.[10] However, Gulshan Kumar was murdered by the [Mumbai mafia](/wiki/Mumbai_underworld "Mumbai underworld") syndicate [D-Company](/wiki/D-Company "D-Company") on 12 August 1997. üìù SUMMARY (Lead Section):
**National Bike Month** is a celebration of cycling held every May in the United States. It is sponsored by the [League of American Bicyclists](/wiki/League_of_American_Bicyclists "League of American Bicyclists") and celebrated in communities from coast-to-coast. Established in 1956, National Bike Month is a chance to showcase the many benefits of bicycling and to encourage more folks to giving bicycling a try.[1]

As part of National Bike Month, National Bike to Work Week is usually held the third week of May, with Bike to Work Day being on that Friday.
